business.headline: Satya Nadella's big announcement for India: Rs 1.5 lakh crore for AI first futureMicrosoft CEO Satya Nadella announced that he is committing USD 17.5 billion, the company's largest-ever investment in Asia, to build infrastructure and skills needed for boosting Artificial Intelligence (AI) in India.

Are ULIPS really giving 14% returns, or is it just smart mis-selling?Can ULIPs genuinely deliver 14% returns, or are these projections built on selective calculations and hidden costs? How accurate are these projections? Expert explains.

Mehli Mistry steps down from NCPA board, Tata Trusts' Vijay Singh replaces him: ReportMehli Mistry was on the NCPA council as a nominee of the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and served alongside other Trusts' representatives, including Jehangir H. Jehangir and Pramit Jhaveri.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as investors cautious ahead of US Fed policy decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 436.41 points to close at 84,666.28, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 120.90 points to end at 25,839.65.

Still waiting for your tax refund? 5 common ITR errors and how to correct themIf your tax refund is taking longer than usual, you're not the only one. In most cases, the delay isn't due to the system but small filing mistakes that can easily be fixed.

Anil Ambani's son Jai Anmol named in Rs 228 crore banking fraud case by CBIThe complaint alleges cheating, criminal conspiracy and criminal misconduct that led to a wrongful loss of Rs 228.06 crore to the bank involved.

Wakefit vs Corona: Which IPO offers the best value? Check detailsIn terms of demand, Corona Remedies is witnessing stronger interest from investors. As of December 9, 2025, the Corona Remedies IPO is subscribed 1.78 times overall

Kaynes Technology shares jump over 9% today: Why is the stock rising?The rebound comes amid bargain hunting and selective buying after the recent correction was triggered by a critical report from Kotak, which flagged gaps in disclosures and raised concerns around the company's working capital position.

Rupee weakness, liquidity stress: Why Sensex and Nifty are under pressureIn the past few sessions, benchmark indices have stayed under pressure. Is the falling rupee to blame, or is foreign selling creating a liquidity squeeze? Here's why Dalal Street is on edge.

Can gold maintain its upward momentum despite today's decline?Gold and silver prices remain cautious as investors await the US Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, with experts highlighting recent market trends and key support levels.

Proposed insurance ombudsman rules: What policyholders should knowThe Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) recently released the Draft Internal Insurance Ombudsman Guidelines, 2025. These rules propose a new accountability structure inside insurance companies to speed up dispute resolution and reduce harassment of consumers.

Are new ITR forms coming before FY28? Here's what the government saysThe Indian government is preparing to implement a new Income Tax Act from April 1, 2026. This article examines the upcoming changes to tax forms, the timeline for notification, and the government's efforts to simplify compliance for taxpayers.

Sensex falls over 700 points: Why is the stock market down today?The Sensex has slipped over 700 points to fall below 84,400, while the Nifty has tumbled below 25,800, led by losses in banking, metal, and IT stocks.
Sensex opens 350 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; Kotak Bank down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 400.82 points to 84,701.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 134.80 points to 25,825.75 as of 9:24 am.
Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market fall again?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,964.5 around 8:03 am, hinting that the Nifty 50 might open close to Monday's closing level of 25,960.55.

Meesho, Aequs IPO debut: Can these listings make you rich? GMP gives a hintMeesho and Aequs shares are set for their stock market debut on December 10. Both IPOs attracted robust investor attention during the bidding phase.

Trump greenlights Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China as US gets 25% cutDonlad Trump said that he had informed President Xi Jinping of China, where Nvidia's chips are under government scrutiny, about the move and he "responded positively," according to Trump's post.

Trump considers fresh tariffs on Indian rice as US farmers allege unfair dumpingThis comes after US farmers urged tougher action, arguing that subsidised rice imports are battering US markets and pushing domestic prices down. Donald Trump vowed to "take care" of the issue and pressed officials to identify countries accused of undercutting US markets.
Monopolies, duopolies and oligopolies: IndiGo's unique grip on global marketNo airline in any major market of the world dominates its home skies like IndiGo does.

Paramount's $108 billion hostile bid for Warner Bros amid Netflix's merger plansNetflix had appeared to clinch the deal on Friday after a weeks-long bidding battle with Paramount and Comcast, securing a $72 billion equity agreement for Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studio, and streaming businesses.

entertainment.headline: New parents Katrina-Vicky are blissful, sleep deprived in 4th anniversary selfie Marking their fourth anniversary, Vicky Kaushal shared a selfie with Katrina Kaif, admitting the couple is "sleep-deprived" after welcoming their baby boy in November. The actor lovingly gazed at Katrina in the sweet post, showing their blissful new chapter as parents.

JioHotstar unveils Vijay Sethupathi's Kaatan, Kajal Aggarwal's Vishakha and more JioHotstar has pledged a significant Rs 4,000 crore investment over five years to boost South India's creative economy. Highlighted by a new partnership with the Government of Tamil Nadu and initiatives aimed at nurturing regional talent.

Smriti Irani gives shout-out to Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar with powerful quote Actor Smriti Irani praised Aditya Dhar's spy-thriller 'Dhurandhar' on social media with a quote, while tagging the film. She highlighted themes of peace and violence.
Not in race for rugby presidency from Himachal, clarifies Rahul Bose Actor Rahul Bose said he won't seek the Rugby India presidency from Himachal Pradesh.

Radhika Pandit lists all roles Yash plays in her life in sweet anniversary post Actors Yash and Radhika Pandit celebrate their wedding anniversary on December 9. To mark the occasion this year, Radhika posted an adorable video reflecting on their relationship.

Unassuming and ego less! Ameesha Patel praises Humraaz co-star Akshaye Khanna Ameesha Patel shared a nostalgic picture from the promotions of 'Humraaz', praising former co-actor Akshaye Khanna's "ego less" persona. She also acknowledged his recent success with Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar'.

Kartik Aaryan reveals why he wanted to be typecast in his early Bollywood years Kartik Aaryan shared honest reflections on his early struggles, his decision to embrace typecasting, and the choices that shaped his career. He now prepares for the release of Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri.

BB19 winner Gaurav Khanna reacts to backlash over his wife's no-kids choice 'Bigg Boss 19' winner Gaurav Khanna has openly supported his wife's decision on motherhood. In an exclusive interview, he also talked about being christened the 'greenest flag'.

Zubeen Garg tribute by Post Malone wows Guwahati crowd. Watch Post Malone paid tribute to the late Assamese music icon Zubeen Garg during his performance in Guwahati. This evoked an emotional reaction from thousands gathered at the concert venue.

Raat Akeli Hai The Bansal Murders trailer: Nawazuddin Siddiqui in a mansion of lies The trailer brings back Nawazuddin Siddiqui as Inspector Jatil Yadav in the crime-thriller, 'Raat Akeli Hai: The Bansal Murders'. The film is set to release on December 19, 2025 on Netflix.

Embarassing: Vishal Dadlani blasts Anuv Jain's Mumbai act with Jacob Collier Anuv Jain faced mixed reactions for his recent performance with Jacob Collier in Mumbai, with social media users and music composer Vishal Dadlani expressing disappointment over the live rendition.

41 years, tender eyes: Shabana Azmi's endearing post for Javed Akhtar wins hearts Shabana Azmi and Javed Akhtar marked 41 years of marriage on December 9. On the occasion, a heartfelt post from the actor prompted a wave of congratulatory messages from colleagues and well-wishers across the film industry. Check it out here.

James Cameron's had a $2 billion argument against splitting Avatar 2 script Facing pushback for expanding the 'Avatar' saga to five films, James Cameron challenged the studio's concern for making "another $2 billion." While 'The Way of Water' validated his confidence, the future of 'Avatar 5' now depends on 'Fire and Ash' crossing the $2 billion global mark.

Zeeshan Ayyub hopes Real Kashmir FC changes mainstream perception of the state Zeeshan Ayyub shares his emotional journey with the Real Kashmir FC series. The show aims to shift the narrative around Kashmir by focusing on human stories beyond politics.

Himesh Reshammiya hits 1.2 billion streams on Spotify, surprises fans with live show Himesh Reshammiya held a special Spotify fan meet to mark his milestone of surpassing 1.2 billion streams on the platform. The event featured live performances, fan interactions, and a heartfelt tribute to actor Dharmendra.

Darshan's The Devil set for huge first-day first-show release, 150 shows booked The Devil, starring Darshan and directed by Prakash Veer, is set to achieve the largest first day opening on single screens in Karnataka, with over 150 early morning shows scheduled and unprecedented ticket sales ahead of its December 11 premiere.

I saw RRR 100 times: Teary-eyed Japanese fan tells Ram Charan, video goes viral A group of Japanese fans travelled to Hyderabad to meet Ram Charan, and one of them grew emotional as she told the actor she had watched RRR "100 times."

Tamannaah Bhatia to play V Shantaram's second wife in biopic. See 1st look poster Actor Tamannaah Bhatia is set to play cinema icon V Shantaram's second wife, Jayashree. The makers unveiled her first look poster today.

Aishwarya Rai clarifies Aaradhya is not on social media, flags fake profile Actor Aishwarya Rai Bachchan recently addressed speculation regarding her daughter Aaradhya's social media presence. She was speaking to the media on the sidelines of the Red Sea Film Festival.

general news.headline: Did Goa Police help Luthra brothers flee after Birch fire? Senior cop respondsDeputy Inspector General of Goa Police, Varsha Sharma, dismissed allegations that anyone from the police force helped the main accused flee to Thailand. "Within five hours they managed to flee because it was their own premises, and they knew what had happened there. Since they were not in Goa, they travelled abroad from Delhi," she said.

Hardik blitz, ruthless bowlers help India crush South Africa, end Cuttack jinxHardik Pandya's all-round blitz and a ruthless performance from the bowlers saw India crush South Africa by 101 runs in Cuttack on Tuesday, December 9.

His days are numbered: Trump won't rule out US troops to oust Nicolas MaduroTrump told Politico that Maduro's days are numbered and refused to rule out sending US ground troops, as he escalates pressure on Venezuela amid expanding strikes on regional drug-smuggling networks.

Pak played it right, India faced tariffs for countering Trump: Raghuram RajanRaghuram Rajan, former RBI Governor, said the US's imposition of a 50% tariff on India had less to do with the purchase of Russian oil and more to do with Delhi's contradicting US President Trump's claim of brokering peace in the May war. He said "Pakistan played well", and escaped with just 16% tariffs.

Pakistan: Why Sindhudesh demand has sparked violence in KarachiThe violence started after protesters hit the streets on Sindhi Culture Day, demanding a separate Sindhudesh. The protesters called for the liberation of Sindh, amplifying a longstanding sentiment of Sindhi nationalist parties.

Dhurandhar proves India can handle the truth without burning a busThe masses, which were always handled by the kid gloves of the intellectual elite, quarantined from the harsh past lest they revolt, have suddenly started accessing history beyond their textbooks.

Centre trims IndiGo operations by 10% to tackle nationwide disruptionsFollowing the order, IndiGo said it will continue to serve all its destinations while complying with the 10% curtailment of operations mandated by the Civil Aviation Ministry.

Satya Nadella's big announcement for India: Rs 1.5 lakh crore for AI first futureMicrosoft CEO Satya Nadella announced that he is committing USD 17.5 billion, the company's largest-ever investment in Asia, to build infrastructure and skills needed for boosting Artificial Intelligence (AI) in India.
A Hyderabad architect opened the Chanel show in New York. Her storyBhavitha Mandava hails from Hyderabad and moved to New York City to pursue a master's degree at New York University.

Belgium's Supreme Court rejects Mehul Choksi's appeal against extradition orderBelgium's Supreme Court rejected fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi's appeal, upholding an earlier order that paves the way for his extradition to India.

Bangladesh moves away from India, makes Brazil its top cotton sourceBrazil has overtaken India as the largest raw cotton supplier to Bangladesh, whose economy depends on the readymade garments sector. The shift coincides with the fall of the Sheikh Hasina regime in Bangladesh. However, India remains the top cotton yarn supplier to Bangladesh.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

Divorces force Chola-era Bengaluru temple to stop weddingsThe 12th-century Someshwara Temple in Bengaluru has stopped hosting marriages after priests were spending more time in court than in rituals. Rising divorce cases and fake documents from eloping couples prompted the Ulsoor temple, built in the Chola period, to halt ceremonies to protect its image and avoid legal hassles.

Student killed, another critically injured in stabbing at North Forsyth High SchoolA stabbing at North Forsyth High School left one student dead and another critically injured. The campus briefly went into lockdown as deputies secured the scene. Authorities say the situation is contained and under investigation.

Out or not out? No-ball controversy over Jasprit Bumrah's 100th T20I wicketIND vs SA: Jasprit Bumrah's 100th T20I wicket, the controversial dismissal of Dewald Brevis, became a major talking point in India's dominant 101-run win over South Africa in the first T20I at Cuttack.

Goa CM orders razing of all illegal clubs, buildings on salt pans after Birch fireThe investigation into the tragic Romeo Lane nightclub fire reveals severe safety lapses and the escape of prime accused to Thailand. Goa authorities are taking swift action including demolition of illegal structures and tightening fire-safety regulations.

Going bald? Scientists say this acne drug might bring your hair backA common acne medicine may soon change the future of hair loss treatment. New research shows clascoterone could become the first breakthrough for male pattern baldness in 30 years.

Humayun Kabir flooded with calls after Humayun Kabir's Babri Masjid appealSuspended Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir's call for donations for a Babri Masjid-style mosque in Bengal has ended with his fellow namesake MLA getting flooded with endless phone calls.

INDIA bloc MPs submit impeachment notice against judge over lamp lighting rowA delegation of INDIA bloc MPs submitted an impeachment notice against Madras High Court Judge Justice GR Swaminathan with 120 signatures. The move followed the Thiruparankundram Karthigai Deepam row.

Lionel Messi to ramp walk in Mumbai, set to auction World Cup memorabiliaLegendary footballer Lionel Messi is visiting India on a 3-day trip. Messi is expected to ramp walk in a Mumbai fashion show and auction one of his FIFA World Cup 2022 memorabilia.

After decades, Pakistan to be divided again; more harm than good, say expertsAfter decades of political hesitation, the long-debated proposal of administrative restructuring of Pakistan is back on the table. Pakistani minister Abdul Aleem Khan has said that carving out smaller provinces is now inevitable. However, experts say that the proposal could do more harm than good.

Sonia Gandhi's birthday message: Jai Hind and Vande Mataram amid national song rowThe timing of Sonia Gandhi's message coincided with the second day of the discussion on Vande Mataram in Parliament. On Monday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi blew the lid open on Jawaharlal Nehru's letter to Subhash Chandra Bose regarding Vande Mataram.

Jasprit Bumrah becomes first India bowler with 100 wickets in all formatsJasprit Bumrah made history in Cuttack by becoming the first Indian bowler to reach 100 wickets in Tests, ODIs and T20Is. He brought up his 100th T20I wicket in the opening match of the series against South Africa.

Smriti Irani gives shout-out to Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar with powerful quoteActor Smriti Irani praised Aditya Dhar's spy-thriller 'Dhurandhar' on social media with a quote, while tagging the film. She highlighted themes of peace and violence.

New parents Katrina-Vicky are blissful, sleep deprived in 4th anniversary selfieMarking their fourth anniversary, Vicky Kaushal shared a selfie with Katrina Kaif, admitting the couple is "sleep-deprived" after welcoming their baby boy in November. The actor lovingly gazed at Katrina in the sweet post, showing their blissful new chapter as parents.

JioHotstar unveils Vijay Sethupathi's Kaatan, Kajal Aggarwal's Vishakha and moreJioHotstar has pledged a significant Rs 4,000 crore investment over five years to boost South India's creative economy. Highlighted by a new partnership with the Government of Tamil Nadu and initiatives aimed at nurturing regional talent.

sports.headline: Samson is like an elder brother: Jitesh Sharma on T20 World Cup keeper rivalry IND vs SA, 1st T20I: Jitesh Sharma opened up about his relationship with Sanju Samson, describing it as one of brothers and saying the Kerala player generously shares his experience and helps him grow as a cricketer.

No fuss, only fire: Hardik's India-first mindset powers dream Cuttack return Hardik Pandya said that he has always kept India and the team first after making his dream return in Cuttack during the first T20I against South Africa. Hardik scored a fifty to save India and help them post a big total.

'Senior' Arshdeep welcomes 'junior' Bumrah to 100-wicket club in T20Is IND vs SA: Jasprit Bumrah completed the milestone of 100 T20I wickets during the first match of the series against South Africa. India seamer Arshdeep Singh welcomed him into the elite list with a big smile and a cheeky comment.

South Africa 74 all out: SA collapse to lowest T20I total after India run riot South Africa were bundled out for 74 during the first T20I against India in Cuttack on Tuesday, handing the hosts a commanding 101-run victory. The total was South Africa's lowest in T20I cricket.

Out or not out? No-ball controversy over Jasprit Bumrah's 100th T20I wicket IND vs SA: Jasprit Bumrah's 100th T20I wicket, the controversial dismissal of Dewald Brevis, became a major talking point in India's dominant 101-run win over South Africa in the first T20I at Cuttack.

Hardik blitz, ruthless bowlers help India crush South Africa, end Cuttack jinx Hardik Pandya's all-round blitz and a ruthless performance from the bowlers saw India crush South Africa by 101 runs in Cuttack on Tuesday, December 9.

Jasprit Bumrah becomes first India bowler with 100 wickets in all formats Jasprit Bumrah made history in Cuttack by becoming the first Indian bowler to reach 100 wickets in Tests, ODIs and T20Is. He brought up his 100th T20I wicket in the opening match of the series against South Africa.

From partners to rivals: Sania, Bopanna face off in TPL exhibition tie Sania Mirza and Rohan Bopanna returned to the court for a special mixed-doubles exhibition, marking Mirza's first match in Ahmedabad in some time. Their reunion highlighted TPL's opening, drawing attention to the league's role in nurturing young tennis talent in India.

Hardik 'clutch' Pandya is true MVP: India all-rounder's 59 vs SA stuns fans IND vs SA, 2nd T20I: Fans praised Hardik Pandya's power-hitting 59-run knock in Cuttack, saying the all-rounder is India's true MVP in T20I cricket as he delivers with both bat and ball whenever the team needs him. Hardik smashed a sparkling unbeaten 28-ball 59 to lift India to 175 for six against South Africa.

Learn from Paris heroes: Sreejesh's message India before 3rd place tie PR Sreejesh asked his team to draw inspiration from India's Paris Olympics heroes ahead of their third-place tie against Argentina in the Jr.men's Hockey World Cup on Wednesday, December 10.

From U19 heroes to India call-ups: G Kamalini, Vaishnavi Sharma make big career jump India rewarded G Kamalini and Vaishnavi Sharma with maiden call-ups as they named the 15-member squad for the T20I series against Sri Lanka to be held later this month. Both players played crucial roles in India's U19 Women's T20 World Cup campaign.

Ashes will get embarrassing if England can't win Adelaide Test: Glenn McGrathFormer Australian pacer Glenn McGrath believes England must win the third Test in Adelaide to avoid an embarrassing Ashes defeat, with Australia holding a commanding 2-0 series lead.

Cook Maggi while Gill bats: Fans slam batter after Cuttack T20I failureFans slammed Shubman Gill after the Indian vice-captain failed with the bat during the Cuttack T20I against South Africa. Gill faced just two balls and scored four runs.

Shubman Gill reveals details of neck injury that sidelined him for a monthIND vs SA, 1st T20I: Shubman Gill has detailed the neck injury that sidelined him for a month, explaining his hospitalisation, rehabilitation at the CoE, and preparation for India's T20I series against South Africa.

Smriti Mandhana resumes national duties, named in India squad for Sri Lanka T20IsSmriti Mandhana has been named in India's squad for the five-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. The left-hander, who was India's key performer in the Women's World Cup, recently called off her wedding with Palash Muchhal.

Lionel Messi to ramp walk in Mumbai, set to auction World Cup memorabiliaLegendary footballer Lionel Messi is visiting India on a 3-day trip. Messi is expected to ramp walk in a Mumbai fashion show and auction one of his FIFA World Cup 2022 memorabilia.

From opener to dropped: Sanju Samson snubbed for Jitesh Sharma in Cuttack T20IAfter excelling as an opener for the Indian team in T20Is, Sanju Samson finds himself dropped for the first match of the series against South Africa in Cuttack on Tuesday, December 9.

MS Dhoni plays pickleball in Dubai, looks fitter than ever before IPL 2026Dhoni was spotted enjoying a relaxed game of pickleball in Dubai ahead of the IPL 2026 auction, showcasing his fitness and high spirits at 44. Dhoni is set for his 19th IPL season and his 17th for CSK.

John Cena reveals shocking truth about WWE exit: Would have done this foreverJohn Cena has dropped a bombshell, saying that his retirement from WWE is not on his own terms. Cena ends his career at the Saturday Night's Main Event on December 13.

Australia-based Nikhil Chaudhary listed as uncapped Indian for auctionAustralia-based all-rounder Nikhil Chaudhary has sparked curiosity ahead of the IPL 2026 auction, having been listed as an uncapped Indian despite playing his professional cricket in Australia.

All alone: Mohamed Salah posts picture of training in empty gym after UCL snubMohamed Salah cut a lone figure at Liverpool's Melwood training ground as he was left out of the squad for the UEFA Champions League clash against Inter Milan on Tuesday, December 9.

Ben Stokes must start the tough conversation after Ashes setback: Nasser HussainNasser Hussain believes England's Ashes revival depends on Ben Stokes delivering hard truths. The former captain says supportive leadership must now give way to tough conversations after back-to-back defeats in Australia.

1st T20I Highlights: SA (74-all-out), India blow away Proteas by 101 runsIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA), 1st T20I Highlights: India smashed South Africa in the opening T20I of the series. Chasing 176, South Africa imploded against a disciplined bowling performance from the host. Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Axar Patel, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube and Varun Chakravarthy were all among wickets as India wreaked havoc on the visitors.

His body keeps letting him down: Wood's Ashes exit soul-destroying, says HussainNasser Hussain has claimed that Mark Wood's body keeps on letting him down as the pacer was ruled out of the Ashes 2025-26 series after another injury setback on Tuesday, December 9.

How's Sunny Leone connected to cricket? R Ashwin's cryptic tweet explainedR Ashwin's cryptic post featuring Sunny Leone and a street photo was actually a playful hint toward young cricketer Sunny Sandhu. The clever wordplay helped spotlight Sandhu's recent heroics in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

Did Wasim Akram take a dig at IPL? Legendary pacer questions length of T20 leaguesAt a PCB event ahead of the 2026 edition, Wasim Akram drew comparisons between the PSL and other T20 leagues, mentioning that PSL's compact and high-tempo format is a lot better than other lengthy T20 leagues.

Is Sanju Samson set for another long stint on the bench?Sanju Samson appears likely to miss out on India's playing XI as the team begins its preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026, with Jitesh Sharma emerging as the preferred wicketkeeper-batter option. India will play 10 T20Is — five against South Africa and another five against New Zealand — in the lead-up to the marquee event, starting in February.

Cheap sensationalism: Hardik Pandya slams paps over girlfriend Mahieka's photoHardik Pandya has criticised paparazzi for invading his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma's privacy when she was returning from a restaurant in Mumbai on Tuesday. He emphasised the need for dignity and boundaries, urging media to act responsibly.

Pooja Tomar vows to guide India's next fighters, plans MMA academy she never hadPooja Tomar wants India's next generation of fighters to receive the guidance she never had. Her dream of opening an academy aims to give young athletes real opportunities, structure and support from the very start.

Mohammed Shami sends strong message to selectors with 4-wicket haul vs HaryanaMohammed Shami delivered a four-wicket haul against Haryana in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025–26. His consistent domestic performances raise questions about his continued exclusion from the national team despite proven fitness.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
